macro.name: VIX index
macro.note: VIX is moderate at 20.70. Volatility is starting to increase.

macro.name: Gold price (GLD)
macro.note: Gold (GLD) is rallying sharply at $367.21. Indicates rising inflation expectations or systemic risk.

macro.name: EUR/USD exchange rate
macro.note: EUR/USD is stable at 1.1587. Indicates balanced global risk/economic outlook.

macro.name: WTI crude oil ($/bbl)
macro.note: WTI Crude at $59.80/bbl. Low price indicates global slowdown or demand weakness.

macro.name: AUD/USD exchange rate
macro.note: AUDUSD at 0.6483. AUD remains under pressure. Strong risk-off or persistent US Dollar strength.
macro.action: Favour US Dollar liquidity over AUD assets; watch commodity prices.

macro.name: US 3yr treasury yield
macro.action: Avoid intermediate locks; prefer short/floating rate instruments.

macro.name: US 30yr treasury yield
macro.note: Yield at 4.74%. Elevated long-term yields reflecting fiscal risk/inflation concerns.
macro.action: Watch the 5.0% threshold. Limit long duration locks.

macro.name: US 10yr treasury yield
macro.action: Watch the Atlas pivot at 4.75%; favour short duration.

macro.name: High yield OAS (bps)
macro.note: HY OAS at 3 bps. US credit stress is low and manageable.

macro.name: Treasury net liquidity
macro.note: Net Liquidity at $6571780B. Liquidity is robust and supportive of risk assets.

micro.name: S&P 500 index
micro.note: S&P 500 Index at 6,680. Strong/stable price action. Low systemic equity risk.

micro.name: ASX 200 index
micro.note: ASX 200 Index at 8,770. Stable price action.

micro.name: Put/Call ratio (PCCE)
micro.note: PCEE Ratio at 0.50. Low hedging (call-buying dominance). High complacency/bullish sentiment.
micro.action: Implement small hedges; avoid chasing market highs.

micro.name: FINRA margin debt (YOY %)
micro.note: Margin Debt YOY at 32.9%. Leverage is expanding aggressively. High risk of forced liquidation if markets fall.
micro.action: Aggressively deleverage equity exposure; increase cash.

micro.name: Small/Large cap ratio
micro.note: Ratio at 0.3593 — small-caps are heavily underperforming. Poor internals.

micro.name: SOFR OIS Spread (bps)
micro.note: SOFR/OIS spread is -5.0 bps. Dollar funding market is stable.

micro.name: Bank CDS index (bps)
micro.note: Bank CDS at 5 bps. Low implied banking stress.

micro.name: Consumer delinquencies
micro.note: Delinquency Rate at 3.0%. Rate is rising. Caution warranted for banks and consumer sectors.
micro.action: Monitor household debt metrics closely; reduce unsecured credit exposure.

overall.comment: Market stability deteriorating rapidly. High caution required.
overall.daily_narrative:
Atlas indicators signal a SEVERE RISK posture, driven primarily by escalating leverage and duration risks. Critical Red indicators include FINRA margin debt, which shows a significant year-over-year increase, alongside a Red signal from the Small/Large cap ratio, indicating a flight from smaller, more speculative assets. Amber signals from the US 10-year and 30-year treasury yields underscore persistent duration risk. While the VIX remains at an Amber level, it does not fully reflect the underlying leverage build-up and rising consumer delinquencies, suggesting a potential complacency in volatility pricing despite clear signs of systemic stress.
The external macro environment reinforces this cautious outlook. As highlighted by Morningstar and Bloomberg, ongoing US shutdown developments are impacting the availability of critical economic data, complicating the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision-making process. Investing.com reports a general struggle in risk markets due to a lack of bullish catalysts, while Bloomberg also features discussions on global and Indian economic risks. Fixed income markets remain a key area of focus, as detailed by Bloomberg's fixed income coverage and a shareholder letter from Dodge & Cox. Readers are directed to the News Feed below for the full list of articles reviewed. An escalation to FULL-STORM would be triggered by the US 10-Year Yield moving above 4.75% or High Yield OAS widening beyond 400 bps.
overall.composite_summary: The market remains in a SEVERE RISK posture, characterized by elevated leverage and duration concerns amidst a challenging macro backdrop.
key_actions: Deleverage existing positions, particularly in speculative assets.
Shift portfolio bias towards defensive sectors and high-quality fixed income.
Implement tactical hedges against potential equity market downturns and credit spread widening.
Actively monitor High Yield OAS for any signs of significant credit deterioration.
Reduce exposure to rate-sensitive assets given persistent duration risk.
